}} is a Japanese voice actor, actor, tarento, narrator, master of ceremonies and
impressionist from Shiogama, Miyagi Prefecture. He graduated from Tohoku Gakuin University's economics
school, and is currently affiliated with Across Entertainment. Before that, he
was affiliated with the Tokyo Actor's Consumer's Cooperative Society.

His nickname is '{{nihongo|Yama-chan|å±±ã¡ãã|Yama-chan}}'. As a
radio personality, he is known as '{{nihongo|Bazooka Yamadera|ããºã¼ã«å±±å¯º|BazÅ«ka
Yamadera}}' among other things. He is best known for his
roles in [[Ninja Scroll]] (as JÅ«bei Kibagami), [[Cowboy Bebop]] (as Spike
Spiegel and Ein), [[Ghost in the Shell]] (as Togusa), [[Neon Genesis
Evangelion]] (as Ryoji Kaji), [[Anpanman]] (as Cheese), [[Ranma Â½]] (as RyÅga
Hibiki/P-chan and the JusenkyÅ Guide) and the current voice of Koichi Zenigata
([[Lupin III]]). [http://www.japan-
zone.com/news/2007/11/index.shtml Alicia Keys Plays Free Show in Tokyo], Japan
Entertainment News - November 30, 2007 He is known for voicing Jim Carrey
and Eddie Murphy in the Japanese language releases of their respective
films.
